page.title: 09THE ARMY APPRENTICES'COLLEGE
page.content: IT was founded in 1947 and in 1960 began training boys for the Royal Signals. At present colonel Carr-Smith is in charge. 960 boys can be trained at once. There are 186 civilians ranging from teachers to gardeners and groundsmen, and 256 army personel. They have lessons in classrooms for their military trade and facilities for physical training.The boys live at the college in four squadrons.The married people live in houses across the road.When they have finished their training they go to the Regualar Army .It trains boys aged 16 to 17 and a half and they must have three o levels in Maths,Physics and English.They can eat in two cafes There is a hobbies room,a library,a carpenters work shop,a cinema and a shop.They have normal school holidays and in free time can go into Harrogate
